basics.name: Johny Serpa
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary:
I am not an informatics prodigy. I always thought I would be working on something related to sports as I usually excelled in it and played football since young.
While enlisting in university, I thought it would be better to not restrict myself only to sports, so I chose Mining Engineering. After realizing it was a bad move, I switched to Hotel Management and finished it in 2014.
By that time, I was struggling to find meaning in what I was doing. Digital nomads were appearing and it led me to another point of view: What kind of life do I want, and what can I be doing in order to have it? Programming seemed like a good choice. After realizing the possibilities that programming opened me, I just started loving it.
Nowadays I'm almost finishing my Informatics degree and already full-time working, I find myself as a highly motivated professional in the pursuit of good challenges and world-changing projects.
My ambitions are to work with cryptocurrencies, blockchain and smart contracts and democratize economy.

volunteer.organization: MYTO - Mathare Youth Talented Organization - Kenya
volunteer.summary: I worked mainly in the MKI (Miss Kogalo Initiative) project as a project manager with a local age-mate. The project consisted in promoting the youths from the slums and giving them tools for them to develop themselves. It attracted people from all ages with beauty contests and during the contests they would also showcase their talents. We also had people to help improve their skills such as: modeling, public speaking and had open discussion about important issues on their communities.
highlights: Development of initiatives for social inclusion
Development of website for project initiative
